{"title":"Dreaming River","artist":"Anita Ngarrindjeri","date":"2023","medium":"Acrylic on canvas","description":"A contemporary piece reflecting Ngarrindjeri riverine traditions and spiritual connection to water.","image_url":"https://museum.org/images/ART-00123.jpg"}

Dreaming River, created by Anita Ngarrindjeri in 2023, is an acrylic on canvas that immerses viewers in the flowing forms and earthy palette of the Murray River, a central artery of Ngarrindjeri country. The artist draws upon traditional Dreaming stories, employing layered brushstrokes to evoke the river’s currents, the whisper of reeds, and the ancestral beings that guard its waters. Through contemporary abstraction, Ngarrindjeri highlights the ongoing relationship between Indigenous peoples and their environment, inviting contemplation of stewardship, cultural resilience, and the river’s role as a living archive of community memory.

Sueño del Río, creada por Anita Ngarrindjeri en 2023, es una obra al óleo sobre lienzo que sumerge al espectador en las formas fluidas y la paleta terrosa del Río Murray, una arteria central del país Ngarrindjeri. La artista se inspira en las historias tradicionales del Sueño, utilizando pinceladas superpuestas para evocar las corrientes del río, el susurro de los juncos y los seres ancestrales que custodian sus aguas. A través de la abstracción contemporánea, Ngarrindjeri destaca la relación continua entre los pueblos indígenas y su entorno, invitando a la reflexión sobre la tutela, la resiliencia cultural y el papel del río como archivo vivo de la memoria comunitaria.
